fields.description: Adds a word to the current lexicon. Note: will replace the word if it already exists
Clears the lexicon
Returns true if the word exists in the lexicon (case-insensitive)
Finds alliterations by comparing the phonemes of the input string to those of each word in the lexicon

parameters.desc: minimum length of word to return (optional, default=4)

fields.description:
Allows one to set/get the raw dictionary data used to create the default lexicon.

See RiLexicon.addWord() for data format

parameters.desc: A map (HashMap in Java, Object in JavaScript) that maps words to their pronunciation and part-of-speech data (optional, for sets only)

returns.desc: this RiLexicon or lexical data map (for gets)

fields.description: Returns a random word from the lexicon. When arguments are supplied part-of-speech and/or syllable-count will be matched as well
Two words rhyme aer considered as rhyming if their final stressed vowel and all following phonemes are identical

returns.desc: rhymes for word, or an empty array if none are found

fields.description:
Returns the array of all words in the lexicon or those matching a specific regex.
If specified, the order of the result array is randomized before return.

returns.desc: all (or the matching) words in the lexicon

fields.description: Returns true if the word haa an adverb form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech are any variant of an adverb in the PENN part-of-speech tag set (e.g. rb, rbr, rbs)

returns.desc: true if the word can be used as an adverb

fields.description: Returns true if the word has a noun form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech are any variant of a noun in the PENN part-of-speech tag set(e.g. nn, nns, nnp, nnps)

returns.desc: true if the word can be used as a noun

fields.description: Returns true for if word has a verb form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech are any variant of a verb in the PENN part-of-speech tag set (e.g. vb, vbg, vbd, vbp, vbz)

returns.desc: true if the word can be used as a verb

fields.description: Returns true if word has an adjective form. That is, if any of its possible parts of speech are any variant of an adjective in the PENN part-of-speech tag set (e.g. jj, jjr, jjs)

returns.desc: true if the word can be used as an adjective

fields.description: Returns true if the two words are alliterations (iff the first stressed consonant of the two match)

returns.desc: true if the first stressed consonant of the two words match

fields.description:
Returns true if the two words rhyme, that is, if their final stressed phoneme and all following phonemes are identical, else false.

Note: returns false if word1.equals(word2) or if either (or both) are null;

Note: at present doesn't use letter-to-sound engine if either word is not found in the lexicon, but instead just returns false.
fields.COMMENT.syntax: isRhyme(String word1, String word2, boolean useLTS)

returns.desc: true if the two words rhyme, else false.

Removes a word from the currently loaded lexicon

whether to return only words that match the length of the input word (optional, default=true)

fields.description: Compares the phonemes of the input word (using a version of the min-edit distance algorithm) to each word in the lexicon, returning the set of closest matches.

parameters.desc: minimum edit distance for matches (optional, default=1)

First calls similarBySound(), then filters the result set by the algorithm used in similarByLetter();
